TextBlock.Text: IDAEA: Station Log 1. Despite my protests, I have been called to service in building this station. Since losing Fuchsia, I am now the most experienced solar engineer the clan has.

IDAEA: I'll do my part in her stead. The clan needs my expertise, so I shall have to swallow my revulsion. As for progress, the blueprints are already largely complete. Pye has jumped into the project with concerning enthusiasm.
IDAEA: The plan, as it stands now, is to construct the warp receiver, main chamber, and emitters, then launch the station into a low solar orbit while the mass is still minimal.
IDAEA: Following that, we can start this dreadful work in earnest. Materials will be brought in by warp, and we can assemble the finer machinery from the inside.
IDAEA: We lay the first scaffolds tomorrow. For now, I think an early night is in order.
PYE: I find your lack of enthusiasm concerning!
IDAEA: I find your interjections childish.
PYE: An early night? Don't you ever get out? Hypothesis: Exposure to more solar activity will be good for you.
IDAEA: Kindly take your hypothesis and place it where there is no solar activity.
